thread.title: Mobile Labs Names Dan McFall President and CEO

author: cnbc.com
title: Mobile Labs Names Dan McFall President and CEO
text:
Experienced software leader set to drive continued growth and innovation
ATLANTA--(BUSINESS WIRE)-- Mobile Labs , a leading provider of enterprise-grade mobile testing and development solutions, has elevated Dan McFall to the role of President and Chief Executive Officer. McFall, who has served as the company’s president since 2016, brings a proven success record in the software and mobility space to his new position of President and CEO.
McFall has held numerous strategy and implementation, solution design, customer acquisition and support and industry growth roles throughout his 19-year career. He will call on that experience, especially his time as Mobile Labs president, to help drive the company to new levels of revenue growth and success in 2018 and beyond.
“Dan’s drive, leadership skills and industry knowledge have made a strong and enduring impact on Mobile Labs,” said Sanjeev Tirath, Mobile Labs board member. “These qualities, along with his passion for innovation, make him the logical choice for the expanded role of President and CEO.”
“We closed out 2017 on a very high note,” McFall said recently. “Our graduation from Atlanta Tech Village, achieving a customer base growth of more than 20%, the launch of new products and the expansion of key staff all represent the formidable growth potential Mobile Labs has in the mobile application marketplace. I look forward to the challenge of leading this innovative team as we continue our track record of success.”
About Mobile Labs
Mobile Labs provides enterprise-grade mobile device clouds that improve efficiency and raise quality for agile–based, cross-platform mobile app and mobile web deployments. The company’s patented device cloud, deviceConnect™, is available in both public and on-premises configurations. deviceConnect provides affordable, highly-secure access to a large inventory of mobile devices across major mobile platforms to developers, test engineers, and customer support representatives, among others. At the heart of enterprise mobile app deployment, deviceConnect enables automated continuous quality integration, DevOps processes, automated testing, and manual app/web/device testing on managed devices. deviceConnect supports all major integrated app development environments (IDEs), such as Xcode, as well as automated app and web testing on real mobile devices using a wide variety of mobile UI test automation tools. deviceBridge™, an extension to deviceConnect, serves as a “virtual USB cable” to checkout and debug cloud-based devices as if they are locally connected. For more information, please visit www.mobilelabsinc.com .
